content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia function to clean a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Replace any leading or trailing whitespaces with nothing
    col = strip(col)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")
    
    return col
end
```

You can use this function like so:

```julia
column_name = "My Column"
cleaned_column = clean_column(column_name)
println(cleaned_column)  # Outputs: my_column
```
